intro: Pteropyrum aucheri, commonly known as the Persian violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pteropyrum aucheri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
